function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Informal signs printed on paper with regular tape may contribute to the spread of contagious diseases if not properly handled or disposed.","Impact":"Increased risk of disease transmission within the built environment.","Mitigation":"Use of digital signs or professionally printed signs with easy-to-clean surfaces and touchless interaction.","Technologies":"Digital signage, touchless interaction technology.","People":"Customers, employees, visitors to the store.","Owner":"Retailers, store managers, signage companies."},{"Description":"Frequent changes to signs and their locations create potential confusion and inconsistency in communicating COVID-related information.","Impact":"Misunderstanding of safety guidelines and increased risk of non-compliance with public health measures.","Mitigation":"Establish a clear and standardized system for sign placement and updates. Provide consistent training to employees on new signage and safety protocols.","Technologies":"Standardized signage templates, digital communication platforms for employee training.","People":"Employees, customers, visitors to the store.","Owner":"Retailers, store managers, government agencies."},{"Description":"Use of traditional paper signs for COVID-related information limits the ability to dynamically update and adapt messaging in real-time.","Impact":"Inability to rapidly communicate changing health and safety information to the public.","Mitigation":"Invest in digital signage systems that allow for real-time updates and dynamic content management.","Technologies":"Digital signage, content management software.","People":"Customers, employees, visitors to the store.","Owner":"Retailers, store managers, technology providers."}]}
